description: Partnership with GREAT (Gender-Responsive Researchers Equipped for Agricultural Transformation) to design, conduct and deliver innovations that integrate gender (https://www.greatagriculture.org/).
Collaboration with the Technical Centre for Agricultural and Rural Cooperation (CTA) in implementing the project “Promoting Youth Entrepreneurship and Job Creation in West Africa’s Rice Value Chain”
Collaboration with University of Illinois, University of Arizona, Colorado State University, University of Connecticut and University of Nicosia for impact assessment of rice technologies in Africa.

Continued partnership with Philippine government agencies, namely, Philippine Rice Research Institute, Bureau of Plant Industry, Department of Agriculture (DA)-Central and Regional Field Offices through three projects funded by the DA
New partnership to support work on crop insurance, development of new algorithm for historical yield data generation and integrating remote sensing based information into Rice Crop Manager
Partnership with private companies (i.e Advanced Chemical Industries Ltd (ACI), Metal Private Ltd) in Bangladesh to bring sustainability in the seed sector with respect to climate resilient rice
CIRAD collaborates with research and development organization on the upgrading of rice value chains in West Africa.

Direct Seeded Rice Consortium, a multi-stakeholder (public-private) consortium, which aims to develop a comprehensive, science-based, agronomic package adapted for direct seeded rice production in Asia
A Global Long-Term Experiment Network (GLTEN) for Sustainable Agriculture
les Systèmes de Production d'Altitude et Durabilité (SPAD), which aims to develop sustainable farming systems in highlands in Madagascar
Sequencing heat MAGIC to identity genes conferring heat tolerance, as key trait in rice for adapting to climate change

Improvement of crop models and prediction of climate change effects and adaptations on rice production

Analysis of disease resistance, characterization of pathogens and development of diagnosis tools

To expand C4 mutant screening capacity, IRRI has initiated collaboration with CAAS, China to formulate a joint laboratory in the Biotechnology Research Institute, Beijing that will become operational in 2018
CIRAD and EMBRAPA work together on dissection of genetic bases of female outcrossing ability and female hybrid seed production ability
CIRAD-CIAT-FLAR collaborate on inventory of elites lines for major irrigated rice breeding programs in Latin America.

Applied research on picture-based insurance and advisory services

In East Africa, development of expanded suite of gridded, online regional historic and forecast climate information products tailored to agricultural needs. Coordination of introduction of new products through Greater Horn of Africa Climate Outlook Forum.

In West Africa, development of expanded suite of gridded, online regional historic and forecast climate information products tailored to agricultural needs. Coordination of introduction of new products through regional Climate Outlook Forum process.
Development and support for use of CRAFT tool.
Development and implementation of tools and products used in the PICSA approach.
Collaboration on Global Framework for Climate Services, including supporting countries to develop national level plans.

Improved rangeland governance in Ethiopia, Tanzania, and Tunisia
Capacity building to convene and sustain multistakeholder platforms that accelerate progress in reforming and implementing policies for people-centered land governance
Understanding community-level tenure factors affecting implementation of forest landscape restoration in Ethiopia and supporting implementation of rights devolution in the 2018 Forest Proclamation
Improving capacities and tools to address the challenges of formalization and tenure security of native communities in Peru
A new artistic platform for disseminating poultry genomics research outputs to the general public and donors
Policy guidelines for informing livestock breed/population improvement and conservation options in developing countries
Development of new tools (chicken and cattle DNA SNPs chips)
Develop livestock master plans, by building more robust and user friendly modelling tools, building capacity and supporting the implementation of these plans
Collaborating on analysis of Infection and Treatment Method (ITM) impact study to determine herd and farm effects as well as household livelihood impacts of ITM vaccinations
AgriFoSe2030- Develop the capacity of recent PhD graduates to undertake policy relevant research and analysis in East Africa
Complementary expertise - research and development activities in the dairy value chains, with possibility to expand to poultry
To develop a joint approach (strategy and planning) to commercializing biofortification in different contexts

Agroknow supported the evolution of GARDIAN by contributing with broadening the discoverability and scope of the system, enabling data integration and interoperability, and enabling a service ecosystem

Through Transform Nutrition West Africa, improve and support policy and program actions to accelerate reductions in maternal and child undernutrition, achieved through an inclusive process of knowledge generation and mobilization.

Adapt and validate a measure of women’s empowerment that agricultural projects can use to diagnose areas of women’s (and men’s) disempowerment; design strategies to monitor project outcomes; and build capacity.
To improve the availability, access, and use of nutrition implementation knowledge in Scaling up Nutrition (SUN) countries
To develop national food-based dietary guidelines for Ethiopia
To co-design and evaluate the implementation of a front-of-packaging labelling of food products to improve nutrition awareness and healthy choices in Vietnam
To support and promote standardized and harmonized policies and regulations for aflatoxins.

To develop stakeholder aligned aflatoxin control action plans and mainstream them into National Agriculture and Food Security Investment Plans in countries countries which have already prioritized aflatoxin mitigation strategies.

Foster knowledge exchange, innovation and learning around a series of annual events for researchers and users of research working at intersection of agriculture, nutrition and health called ANH Academy

To develop a One Health Regional Network – individuals and organisations in the Horn of Africa that can undertake high quality research into links between people’s health, wealth, livestock, environment.
Implementation and assessment of delivery for the supply of biofortified crops (extension services, farmer organization and training) in Bangladesh, Kenya, and Vietnam
Public private partnerships for the supply and demand of biofortified crops/foods in Bangladesh and India
Through an MSc grant scheme, engage and build capacity of young researchers and their supervisors from local universities in food system related research
Contributions to global, regional and national investments in food safety

To determine resistance of mosquitoes breeding around different crops in West and Central Africa; identify which system has a greater risk of contributing to resistance in mosquitoes that transmit malaria
Enhancing the agricultural research system in Pakistan
Evaluation of innovative extension methods in East Africa
Evaluations of contract farming innovations to increase inclusion of women

Develop and evaluate light-touch market-based approaches to improving food safety, while safeguarding livelihoods and reducing the burden of food-borne disease in informal, emerging, and niche pork markets in Vietnam
To produce and multiply certified seed of released varieties of iron beans for delivery to farmers in Rwanda

To develop a system to classify animal diseases by economic impact that includes production losses, expenditure, wider economic impacts including health health, plus human reaction to disease presence or risk
Promote cultivation and consumption of of underutilised nutrient-rich biodiversity by providing evidence, influencing policy, and raising awareness in Brazil, Kenya, Turkey, and Sri Lanka

Address evidence gaps related to effects of agricultural interventions on maternal and child nutrition, specifically, to assess impact of incorporating a behaviour change communication strategy into an agricultural credit program
Incorporation of CCAFS climate science into the Rainforest Alliance voluntary certification scheme.

Formulation, coordination and adoption of the policies, plans, programs and projects for the Agricultural, Fisheries and Rural Development sector, including scaling up of climate actions in agriculture.
Secondment of FP1 staff to the World Bank to facilitate linkages between CGIAR research and the Bank's agriculture portfolio.
Scientific inputs into the CSA program, including metrics for measuring CSA progress, prioritization at the regional level, soil carbon, and global policy engagement.

Research, capacity development and policy engagement. Included joint engagement in UNFCCC processes, scaling out CSA at the regional and global levels, and addressing emissions from the livestock sector.
Scientific inputs into the CSA program, including metrics for measuring CSA progress, prioritization at the regional level, soil carbon, and global policy engagement.
Integrations of CSA approaches and exposure maps into decision-making by Root Capital and the Council on Smallholder Agricultural Finance.

Learning alliance for adaptation in agriculture, and joint efforts focused on climate-nutrition interface, scaling up private sector investments, gender transformative approaches, and South-South cooperation.

Work on sustainable intensification of plant production in Sub-Saharan Africa, business models and financial incentives for CSA, biological nitrogen fixation for smallholders, and modelling of CCAFS scenarios.
Support to KDB and State Department of Livestock in developing a dairy NAMA and for submission to the Green Climate Fund.

Testing public private partnership business models and facilitating the creation of an enabling environment with a strong focus on institutional adjustments and capacity development in the Ethiopian veterinary sector
Quality assurance for thermostable PPR vaccines
Mycoplasma research and genomics

The team is supporting the COPO tool implementation to streamline metadata entry to GARDIAN and Center repositories. The Tool facilitates the standarization of dataset column headings with ontology/GACS terms
Mini-grant recipient that is co-investing in developing the analytic pipelines for linking GARDIAN to modeling tools and the AgMIP data translators.

Contributing to: development of an ontology independent, flexible and extensible metadata schema; testing an MSI supported software platform for secure data management; developing a mash up of the existing ontologies.

Providing guidance on managing personally identifiable information in geo-spatial data, developing a common analytics environment linked to GARDIAN technical training on the use of R/Python programming for spatial analyses.
Research collaboration around validation of data services: "Clean Historical Weather Data” and "Seasonal Probabilistic Forecast".

Rothamsted Research supports reference for calibration of WLE’s dry spectral calibrations and partners on the Africa Soil Information Service project and development of new initiatives to take advances to scale.
Africa Soil Information Service furthers the development of state-of-the-art national soil information systems based on soil-plant dry spectral analysis and digital soil property mapping.

International/national/scientific/academic partnership to assess sustainability at household and landscape levels to determine how land-based options contribute to building sustainable landscapes; country-level to determine SDG achievement and the trade-offs/synergies among objectives.
A partnership for developing decision support tools to provide solutions to water management challenges in Honduras
Promotes dialogue between scientists and policy makers on desertification, land degradation and drought (DLDD)

Linkages with other CGIAR and external partner joint initiatives, including the Innovation lab for Small-Scale Irrigation which includes Texas A&M Univereseity, International Water Management Institute(IWMI) and International Livestock Research Institute(ILRI).
Influencing the key messages going to the High-Level Political Forum on the review of the nutrition targets under the SDGs
A research collaboration between International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) and University of Development Studies, Ghana (UDS) on the impacts of a motor pump experiment

A tri-lateral research collaboration with International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) on nutrition sensitive irrigation under the Feed the Future Innovation Lab on Small Scale Irrigation (ILSSI)

Agricultural Transformation Agency (ATA) is implementing solar pumps in 16 districts in Ethiopia. ATA asked IWMI to undertake impact assessment and support in planning given past experience in pilot schemes
Uptake of WLE research on Resource, Recovery and Reuse (RRR) business models
Support of United Nations publications
Public Private Partnerships on Fortifer production
Advisor on food and the circular economy
WLE continues to liaise with the Food, Energy-Environment and Water Network (FE2W network) which supports co-development and implementation of Nexus tools and approaches
Integration of innovative nature-based solutions to climate adaptation into city planning

WLE is part of the Sustainable Water Future Programme(WaterFuture) of Future Earth, a global platform facilitating international scientific collaboration to solutions to water problems, through the International Water Management Institute(IWMI).

WLE participates in the Ramsar Science and Technical Review Panel(STRP), which provides scientific and technical guidance to the Conference of the Parties, Standing Committe and the Ramsar Secretariat
University of Bonn is a partner in Flagship 5’s decision analysis work, providing scientific and technical support and student co-supervision.
Working with World Agroforestry Centre (ICRAF) in Disa Forest, Tigray.
Discovery and scaling (AOCC)

Piloting and scaling.  Smallholder agroforestry systems for food security and livelihood enhancement; landscape restoration and Farmer Managed Natural Regeneration (FMNR)
FP4 aims to develop functional relationships linking public, private and local civil society partners to develop multi-functional landscapes at scale.

Updates on Projects to support GCF Jurisdictional Strategies and Investment Plans. FP5 worked with 28 sub-national jurisdictions across the world, gathered under GCFTF on the issue of assessing land-use sustainability.
Inclusive business / inclusive finance. Provide access to project evaluation data and mobilize and establish linkages with inclusive businesses
Mobilize and establish linkages with financial institutions and investors

Research collaboration, partnership for germplasm distribution, safeguarding of genetic resources, recipient of capacity building and other genebank services

International PGRFA policy development and compliance, capacity building for policy implementation at national level

To develop an economic trait assessment of two product profiles.

Provide colleagues from ICRISAT the opportunity to observe the state of the art breeding operations.
Development of analytical tools, software, and capacity development.
Development of phenotyping software.
Development and curation of RTB crop ontologies, including mapping of crop-specific traits to species-neutral concept, thus enabling search across species, which is needed for comparative genetics.
Carry out metabolomic assays and analysis of RTB crop samples for diversity analysis, characterization of metabolic pathways related to complex traits, and putative candidate gene discovery.
A computational infrastructure with analysis pipelines designed for breeders to apply high density genomic information in cultivar development to increase the rate of genetic gain.

Training of development partners on ICT4Ag concepts and tools
Testing of banana hybrids and landraces for consumer acceptance and the first improved hybrids selected for on-farm testing

Provide technical backstopping, innovations, and capacity building along the entire potato value chain to increase its productivity, competitiveness, and improve the livelihoods of small and marginal farmers.

Increased agricultural system productivity, food security, and healthier diets in Bangladesh’s delta region through access and adoption of resilient salt-tolerant potato and better agronomic practices.
Improving rural livelihoods of small-scale farmers by increasing incomes and food security as an end result of the joint CIP-HZPC breeding efforts
Strengthening molecular tools and molecular breeding for sweetpotato
Multi-stage selection and allocation of breeding resources
Back stopping and feedback for CIP population hybrid breeding program
Strengthening mixed model analysis for sweetpotato breeding
Establish robust genetic and genomic resources for yams by developing genome-enabled platforms.
Provide training on Fusarium disease field identification, sample taking and lab-based diagnostics.
Development of a diagnostic tool based on polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for rapid, robust and specific detection and identification Xanthomonas vasicola pv. musacearum
Modelling Banana Bunchy Top Virus (BBTV) spread for predicting rate and scale of spread in Africa
Development of a bioinformatics online tool for the quick detection of pathogen sequences from metagenomics datasets
Implement a study on bioavailability of iron in biofortified potatoes
Assess the effect of supplementation of sweetpotato vines silage on dairy cattle and explore its potential use as an alternate supplement feed to other dairy farmers in central-Uganda and beyond
In coordination with local governments, Synergos and IITA have reinforced the capacities of cassava processors in three Nigerian states.
Trials conducted to test the inclusion of high-quality cassava peels into chicken feed. Results showed that cassava peels may replace up to 25% of maize in the formulation.
Assist commercial bakery outlets in Kenya to introduce orange-fleshed sweetpotato purée in their products. Naivas Supermarket started commercializing these new products in January 2018.
Support transfer of technologies for producing shelf-stable preservative-free orange-fleshed sweetpotato puree in Sub-Saharan Africa.

A research partnership for tilapia genetics and the application of genomic selection tools is enabling the selection of tilapia based on genetic markers, expanding GIFT research beyond a faster growth-oriented focus to introduce selection for new characteristics, such as disease resistance, resilience and feed efficiency, unique and new characteristics for tilapia globally.

A partnership for fish disease diagnostics, surveillance and control is developing epidemiology and health economic analytic tools and pond/host patho-microbiome research for early warning of fish disease. Special attention is being given to responding to TiLV transmission aspects and development of non-invasive sampling methods.

The growing partnership for assessing/managing antimicrobial resistance in aquaculture is drawing together key globally leading research institutions in cooperation with the CGIAR Antimicrobial Resistance Hub.

A partnership for aquaculture genetics policies in Southern and Eastern Africa, which has endorsed the FISH research program on genetics of three regional species, namely: O. mossambicus in Mozambique and South Africa; O. shiranus in Malawi and O. andersonii in Zambia and launched work on a regional strategy for access and benefit sharing for SADC
member states to share the improved genetic materials from the three regional species.

A diverse set of partners from regional to national level under the partnership between WorldFish and the African Union Inter-African Bureau for Animal Resources within the EU-funded FishTrade for a Better Future project, contributed multiple outcomes related to facilitation of fish trade within key African trade corridors.

A partnership for Illuminating Hidden Harvests; the contribution of small-scale fisheries to sustainable development. Focusing on social, environmental, economic and governance contributions of small-scale fisheries at global and local scales; key drivers of change; and threats/opportunities. The partnership developed methodologies and some key formative publications in 2018, aiming for key influencing policy moments in 2020.

The most significant gender partnership is our engagement with KIT, including in 2018 the integration of the FISH gender strategy across the portfolio of gender-related projects. Importantly, the partnership includes building capacity with key partners to ensure FISH is able to deliver a gender-integrated approach.

The collaboration with these two research institutions aims to strengthen the quality of research and work on impact and outcome assessment in the field of aquaculture and small scale-fisheries. This will help to evaluate FISH specific innovations, interventions, investments and policies, and their related linkages to both the FISH CRP targets and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Development of a bioinformatics online tool for the quick detection of pathogen sequences from metagenomics datasets
Modelling Banana Bunchy Top Virus (BBTV) spread for predicting rate and scale of spread in Africa
Gender CCT_ Production of joint knowledge products, hosting joint workshops and participating in key forums to inform gender integration and enhance uptake of FTA research under UNFCCC and CBD.
Gender CCT_ Produce knowledge products to enhance the quality of FTA gender research, with emphasis on conceptual and methodological development on emerging topics (intersectionality, youth).
